title: Ticket #1275: Startd EXCEPTs if unable to set timer watching starter
description: The startd will except if it is unable to set the timer that determines how long to wait until it should kill the starter, and there is no input validation on KILLING_TIMEOUT so an invalid value would cause the startd to except every time it wants to shut down the starter quickly (like a claim deactivation). Seems like there should be be input validation on KILLING_TIMEOUT, and if there is to be an EXCEPT have it done at startup.
check_ins: 2013-Jun-04 16:32   Check-in [35991]: Do input validation on KILLING_TIMEOUT. #1275 Make certain KILLING_TIMEOUT is a positive number. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
